doc.field: Communications Workers of America, District 2 Arbitration Cases
Communications Workers of America, District 2 Arbitration Cases

District 2-13 is responsible for servicing all CWA locals in Pennsylvania, Maryland, Delaware, Virginia, West Virginia, and the District of Columbia. Members are employed in many different sectors of the economy including, telecommunications; health care; higher education; manufacturing; broadcast and cable television; commercial printing and newspapers; state, local, and country government. Capture of the website began in 2009 at http://district2.cwa-union.org/. News listings on the website date back to 2004, focusing on bargaining, strike votes, voice over internet protocol (VOIP), cable, Verizon, AT&T, T-Mobile, conferences, workplace injuries, and political action campaigns. In late 2010, the website redesigned. It contains district and national CWA news, photographs, bargaining with Mobility and AT&T, CWA-COPE (the political action committee) information, and event listings. At the 2011 CWA convention, Districts 2 and 13 merged and the website reflects that change. From 2011-2016, the website spotlighted action campaigns related to the 2011 Verizon strike, petition, and picket line; the sale and merger of T-Mobile USA to AT&T; the Piedmont Agents local union; Call Center Worker and Consumer Protection Bill; opposition to the Trans-Pacific Partnership; scholarships, and bargaining with SuperMedia LLC, Verizon, AT&T, USAir, LifePath, Inc., Consolidated Communications, Inc., American Red Cross, Frontier Communications, Atlantic Broadband, Windstream, Duquesne Club, Comcast, DE State 9-1-1 and Civilian Employees, Verizon Select Services, United States Infrastructure, AT&T Mobility, Verizon TeleProducts, INOVA, Delaware State 922 and Civilian Employees, the Greenbrier CSX Hotels, United Planning Organization, Share Group, PIW, American Airlines, ITS, Catholic Charities of Washington, DC, and Dex Media. In 2017, the layout of the website was changed, with additional bargaining updates from Altice, MX1, Nokia, DirecTV, and Thryv. The website also focused on Pennsylvania get out the vote and endorsements. In 2020, the website focused on resources for membership on the COVID-19 pandemic and anti-racism work.

In 2021, the Communications Workers of America, District 2-13 redesigned their website and started using an new URL. CWA District 2-13 provides services for CWA locals in Pennsylvania, Maryland, Delaware, Virginia, West Virginia, and the District of Columbia. The websites contains union political endorsements, bargaining reports at their workplaces (Altice, American Airlines, American Red Cross, AT&T, AT&T Mobility, Atlantic Broadband, AVAYA, Community College of Baltimore, CCI, Century Link, Comcast, Delaware State Employees, Duquesne Club, Frontier, ITS, LifePath, Nokia, Piedmont Airlines, PIW, Printing, Publishing, and Media Workers, Thryv, Verizon and Windstream), scholarships, broadband access, and other news from the union.
Crawl was limited to domains and subdomains of cwad2-13.org in order to remain within the collection scope and data constraints.

Due to technical or privacy issues, archived websites may not be exact copies of the original website at the time of the web crawl. Certain file types will not be captured dependent on how they are embedded in the site. Other parts of websites that the crawler has difficulty capturing includes Javascript, streaming content, database-driven content, and highly interactive content. Full-Text searches of archived websites are available at https://archive-it.org/organizations/567.
